message.content: cs.LO, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.PL, cs.ET - The paper deals with the modeling and analysis of systems using temporal logics, which is a topic that falls under the scope of several CS sub-categories. However, the focus on the relationship between continuous-time and discrete-time models and the development of a discretization technique suggests that the paper is most likely to be classified under cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) or cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), as these sub-categories often deal with formal methods and automated reasoning. The paper's application to system analysis and control also makes it relevant to cs.SY (Systems and Control) and cs.PL (Programming Languages). Finally, the use of metric temporal logic (MTL) suggests a connection to cs.ET (Emerging Technologies), which includes topics such as cyber-physical systems and real-time computing.
